channel.title: Help :D
channel.description: well im not asking for much help but i just made my client that auto download the cache it works fine for me and when i jar it it look like this client.jar i open it its fine for me and working normal but everyone else get cannot find main class whats wrong?

item.title: Help :D
item.dc:creator: @mostwanted8 mostwanted8
item.description:
@mostwanted8 wrote:

nvm i think the problem is the client it self i sent the client to my friend before jaring it and it said same thing but weird thing thats its working for me.

item.title: Help :D
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

No it doesnt matter wether or not you use the jar maker or cmd.

and what do you mean by this:

in the jar files would it matter if the java files are still in the folder?

Read full topic

item.title: Help :D
item.dc:creator: @mostwanted8 mostwanted8
item.description:
@mostwanted8 wrote:

does it matter if i jar the files with the jar maker or Cmd and ill try replacing client with Gui
tough in the jar files would it matter if the java files are still in the folder?

Read full topic

item.title: Help :D
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

It might work for you because you already had the cache in your C:drive… make sure you edited the cachedownloader correctly…
and make sure that when you jarred the file, if you had a file called EGUI or Gui, that you used that as your manifest location instead of client.java

Read full topic
